title: Woman Accuses Epstein of Repeated Rapes and Assaults in New Lawsuit
text:
NEW YORK—A woman at the center of sex-trafficking charges against Jeffrey Epstein filed a lawsuit Wednesday against the former financier’s estate, describing in graphic detail for the first time her alleged recruitment at age 14 to perform sex acts for him.

Since Mr. Epstein’s suicide in August, at least six women have filed lawsuits seeking compensation for what they allege are damages sustained from years of sexual abuse. The suit filed in federal court in Manhattan by “Jane Doe” appears to be the first brought by one of the three unidentified minor victims featured in the criminal indictment charging Mr. Epstein in July.

Mr. Epstein was found dead Aug. 10 in a jail cell in Manhattan, where he was held as he faced the federal sex-trafficking charges. His will was filed in the U.S. Virgin Islands the following week; Mr. Epstein’s longtime personal lawyer Darren Indyke and his accountant Richard Kahn are the executors of the estate, which court filings estimated to be worth at least $577 million.

Wednesday’s lawsuit—which alleges sexual assault, sexual battery, intentional infliction of emotional distress and negligent infliction of emotional distress—names Mr. Indyke and Mr. Kahn as defendants, in their capacities as the estate’s executors.

Lawyers for Mr. Indyke and Mr. Kahn didn’t immediately respond to requests for comment.

Jane Doe was identified as Minor Victim-1 in the criminal indictment filed against Mr. Epstein in July, according to the lawsuit. According to the suit, Jane Doe was contacted in March by authorities investigating Mr. Epstein’s alleged decadeslong scheme to recruit and abuse children. The woman “confidentially cooperated with the investigation, recounting Epstein’s abuse in painstaking detail over the course of many meetings,” the lawsuit says.

Mr. Epstein was arrested in July. The two-count indictment against him was dismissed after his death.

The July indictment said little about Minor Victim-1 except that she was about 14 years old in 2002, when she allegedly was recruited to engage in sex acts with Mr. Epstein.

The lawsuit filed Wednesday goes into graphic detail about the circumstances of Jane Doe’s recruitment and Mr. Epstein’s alleged abuse. Jane Doe’s family was in “serious financial straits,” the lawsuit alleges, and another teenage girl said she could make money by working for Mr. Epstein. The two girls went to Mr. Epstein’s Manhattan townhouse, where Jane Doe was instructed to touch Mr. Epstein as he masturbated, the lawsuit alleges.

On subsequent visits, the lawsuit alleges, Mr. Epstein’s assaults escalated, as he directed her to perform sexual acts while naked, including with other girls and an Epstein employee.

The lawsuit says she became financially dependent on Mr. Epstein, stopped attending school and spent almost all her time “gratifying him sexually” or recruiting other girls for him. The lawsuit also names Epstein employees who Jane Doe alleges facilitated Mr. Epstein’s abuse.

Jane Doe has struggled with anxiety and depression since extricating herself from Mr. Epstein, at the age of 17, the lawsuit alleges.

description: A woman at the center of sex-trafficking charges against Jeffrey Epstein filed a lawsuit against the late financier’s estate, describing in graphic detail for the first time her alleged recruitment at age 14 to perform sex acts for him.
